p: The WHO [ 132] reports that >28% of the world’s population is visually impaired and almost half of this could be prevented. The same report highlights that “ …while the median out-of-pocket spending on health represents <20% of total health spending in high-income countries, it accounts for >40% in low-income countries”. Additionally, rural areas of many countries have low coverage in ocular health care (childhood myopia, cataract) whilst urban lifestyle leads to an increase in myopia and diabetes complications (i.e., diabetic retinopathy).
